doc.after: Santo Domingo is the location of numerous museums, many of which are located in the Zona Colonial district.[18] In the Zona Colonial is the Museum of AlcÃ¡zar, in Diego Colon's restored palace,[22] the Museum of the Casas Reales, with artefacts of the colonial period and a collection of ancient weapons donated by Trujillo,[23] the Naval Museum of the Atarazanas, in the former naval yards, Museo de la Catedral, Museo Memorial de la Resistencia Dominicana, documenting the struggle for freedom during the regimes of Trujillo and Balaguer, Museo Duarte, dedicated to the hero of Dominican independence, and the World of Ambar Museum.
